resource.chars:
To sum up what has been said: It appears 
that the Salpae are not as has been generally 
supposed an aberrant form of the Tunicata 
but rather that they are connected by insensible 
gradations with the other forms of the group; 
Neither is there any circumstance in their 
two modes of multiplication at all at variance 
with what takes place in other genera of the 
family -
The distinction between monochitonidous &
dichitonidous Tunicata cannot be kept up in its 
present sense - for the proper inner and outer 
tunics are equally adherent in all Tunicata 
- and as expressing the degree of adherence of the 
Test to the outer tunic - the distinction is of no 
value - systematically - as the character may vary 
greatly in the same or closely allied genera -
